content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 15 ยง 68.8 - Use of slow-moving vehicle emblem

State Regulations

The only use of the SMV emblem shall be as follows: (a) Agricultural equipment, whether towed or
self-propelled, designed for operation at speeds not in excess of 25 miles per
hour when traveling on or moving along a public highway during day or night, shall each display the slow-moving vehicle emblem. (b) [Reserved]
(c) Every vehicle drawn by animals shall
display on the rear either: (1)
a slow-moving
vehicle emblem; or
(2)
a lighted
lantern with a red lens at least four inches (10.16 centimeters) in diameter, the center of such lens to be 42 inches (106.68 centimeters) above the ground, the lantern to be near the left edge of the vehicle, and at least 72 square
inches (309.648 square centimeters) of a high quality white or whitish-gray
reflective tape. (d) Every self-propelled unit of road construction and maintenance machinery or
other machinery designed for operation at speeds not in excess of 25 miles per
hour when traveling on or moving along a public highway during day or night
shall display the slow-moving vehicle emblem except when engaged in actual
construction or maintenance work either guarded by a flagman or clearly visible
warning signs, and except that a hazard vehicle as defined in section
117-a
of the Vehicle and Traffic Law engaged in a hazardous operation as defined in
section
117-b
of the Vehicle and Traffic Law shall not be required to display a slow-moving
vehicle emblem when the amber light is legally being used upon such
unit. (e) A slow-moving vehicle
with emblem attached and visible from the rear while being transported upon
another vehicle, other than a slow-moving vehicle, shall have the emblem
covered in such a manner that it will not be visible to traffic. (f) The SMV emblem shall not be put to any
use other than prescribed by this Part. Notes
